r29.3 brings support for Designer Pro licenses to r29. This will allow users to open r29.3 with either a Designer Legacy License or a Designer Pro License. For more information, see legacy licenses.
This allows projects that include Disguise Solo servers to use Editor machines with Designer Pro licenses.
There are now new `writeStageMovie()` and `writeFeedMovie()` endpoints in the Plugins API. You can learn more about our Developer APIs in the Developer Portal.
In d3Net Manager “Pro” range servers have been renamed to “VX” range.

d3Service will now automatically check CodeMeter WebDepot for updated licenses and will update them for you. This will mean that monthly and yearly Pro subscriptions, as well as updates to expiry dates on any legacy licenses, will be updated automatically on your machine without you needing to manually activate a new license each time it renews. License update checks happen every 12 hours, and only if Designer is not running.
Improve performance of d3service when querying licenses (this should improve d3Manager startup time in most cases).
Designer now has better debug logging to detect issues with bulk modifications of QuickCal Reference Points.
System diagnostics now include a detailed summary of all CodeMeter Container details for easier troubleshooting.
The term “d3” will now appear as “Designer” or “Disguise” in the EULA text.
Solo range servers now correctly report that they are supported up to r29.3.
Designer will no longer fail to launch on RX range machines even when they have a valid Designer or Pro license.
System Diagnostics now include more detailed licensing logs for faster diagnostics.
Licenses will no longer be incorrectly reported as Perpetual in d3Manager in certain rare cases.
Disguise servers equipped with Bluefish capture cards will no longer excessively log errors in rare scenarios when dropping frames.
Designer will no longer treat MTC as lost when running at lower than 55 FPS.
Shortcuts in the d3 project folder now show content in sub-folders.
These objects are also correctly considered for missing media notifications and highlighting
Designer no longer fails to process multiple Midi notes controlling an event transport if the notes are sent very close together.
FBX skeletons with multiple root bones now load correctly. (A root bone is automatically added as the parent of all roots).
The expressions “self.min” and “self.max” no return the min and max values of a Metafield correctly again.
RenderStream: channel mappings list now automatically updates when adding and removing channel mappings.
Controlling an Open Layer field by pick-whipping another field to make an expression will now work correctly again.
In OCIO mode, arrowing a Layer into a LUT layer and then undoing the creation of the arrow will now correctly break the link and un-apply the LUT.
OCIO options are no longer visible in the PreComp Texture Widget when in Normal Gamma Colour Space mode.
Renderstream assets that are configured to have a custom gamma in ACES mode, and then are turned back to gamma mode will no longer spam the console.
Editing multiple layers at once now correctly displays OCIO fields and the fields correctly affect the layers.
Certain 2.5D assets when updated from r29.1.1 to r29.1.2 will no longer render in GUI colour space when it should be rendering in working space.
Spatial mapping outlines now correctly turn invisible when their editors are closed.
Texture Widget: Type filters are now always visible for all created texture types
Non-functional Lock/Unlock Files button removed from VideoClip object
The Test Pattern layer now renders consistently across colour management modes
Tracking marker layer now displays the correct colours when using different OCIO input transforms.
Support non-16:9 camera aspect ratios with “region of interest”
OSC output with customisation using Expressions
OSC Output Expressions: Ability to output via OSC what Timecode is coming into Disguise
It is now possible to resize the track widget horizontally instead of only vertically and there is a useful button for restoring the default size.
The quit and quit-all confirmation pop-ups will now appear above splash messages to make closing Designer easier.

The title of the Blend Profile graph has been renamed from “Blend Region Black Level” to “Dynamic Blend Region Black Level” so that it is more obvious that it is referring to the black of the blend zone, not to the projector black.
Sockpuppet protocol text no longer extends past the end of layers.
DMX lights will no longer produce an “INTEGER_DIVIDE_BY_ZERO” exception when deleted from the stage.
When double-clicking on a project file in D3Manager, the project name will no longer be editable by default.
A sockpuppet layer controlled from Porta no longer displays a single frame at the default value before setting controlled parameters.
The time synchronisation between multiple Designer machines will no longer break under specific network configurations involving multiple VPNs.
Designer will no longer extend an inserted layer beyond the timeline end.
The CDL setting in Video module now works correctly in OCIO.
Setting the placeholder of a VideoIn to **None** will no longer retain the last placeholder image selected until a system reboot.
HDMI VFC cards will no longer occasionally be detected as DP 1.2.
Designer now displays a friendly warning instead of an Access Violation when arrowing from an Open Layer to a Metafield (min, max, step etc.).
Zoom & Focus data is now correctly captured in the shot recorder again.
Designer will no longer intermittently hang after boot or applying feed settings when in very noisy networks.
Custom OCIO configs which do not define the built-in transform to be sRGB now display correctly in the visualiser.
The SpinBitmap layer now correctly shows dynamic OCIO transform fields.
Actor status icons now show tooltips again.
Resolved an issue where d3 could crash to desktop during apply feeds or when in certain rare GPU states.
Designer will no longer log lots of errors to the console when entering the feed scene while colour management is set to Gamma space.

Transitioning between content targeting a Precomp Display using TrackFade transitions will now fade correctly. The content in the Precomp will not snap to black regardless of the TrackFade transition content.
Designer now properly accepts variables in the `selected index` field of list indirection controllers.
OCIO - Editing the dynamic properties of a video clip’s or video module’s OCIO colour space will no longer affect all video clips and modules that share that colour space.

OCIO is a widely adopted open-source colour management solution. For more details on OCIO, visit https://opencolorio.org. For details on how OCIO is implemented in Designer, see the detailed documentation here
The Colour Inspector is a new tool in Designer for inspecting the specific colour values of pixels within an image. It is useful for verifying content and colour workflows.
Colour calibration for XR now supports ACES and OCIO modes.
Using Notch with Designer now supports both ACES and OCIO modes.
In OCIO mode, the working colour space is configurable. See the user guide OCIO section for details on how to set the working colour space.
OCIO supports the RenderStream layer. Sharing OCIO information with content engines over RenderStream was out of scope for this improvement.

In OCIO mode, default input and output transforms can be configured so they are automatically applied to media and output devices. See the user guide OCIO section for details on how to set the default input and output transforms.
Right-clicking on a project or project file within d3Manager now provides options to duplicate and rename projects and project files.
The notification “Vimba X SDK/Driver not installed” now only appears when using the OmniCal workflow.
Logging now contains a full stack trace for certain error conditions
Fixed an issue where exporting generic DMX personality for VIDEOTRIGGER produced divide by zero error
Fixed an issue where selecting masks in feed rectangles made 1 pixel of gradient
Content now looks correct in the visualiser in ACES mode
The ACES transform box is now properly aligned with other fields
Gamma space profile no longer applied to feed rects in the UI
The tracking marker module is now properly applied the IDT of the palette
CTRL + SHIFT + D now correctly duplicates and renames layers again!
Designer will no longer report an access violation on launch when certain rare configurations of history files exist on disk.
The visualiser camera will no longer stop rendering when an LED screen is added to the stage and no default gamma space has been set.
Users must update the IP-VFC firmware version to 23.0.7 for compatibility with Designer software version r29.0 onwards.
You now no longer need to enable the `enableSDIIPVFC` option switch to use your IP-VFC with SDI SFPs
The IP-VFC card’s list of supported formats now correctly hides unsupported formats.
IP-VFC cards will now output an SDI video stream correctly if only a single SFP is attached to the 2nd output port.
IP-VFC cards now no longer expose a **TPG** field when in SDI mode.
IP-VFC cards in SDI mode can no longer independently be set to 'Frame Replay'.
You can now select your PTP profile on the IP-VFC from the Designer interface when in ST 2110 output mode.
You can now fully configure your IP-VFC card without requiring SFPs to be connected first.
IP-VFC cards in an understudy machine will no longer take on the network port configuration of the IP-VFCs in the machine they are taking over from during failover.
IP-VFC cards now Startup network interfaces on boot much more quickly.
IP-VFC cards will no longer intermittently hang indefinitely when you modify their network configuration.
Selecting PTP sync in the feed view will now automatically set all installed IP-VFCs in ST 2110 output mode to PTP sync mode.
The Genlock indicator in the feed view no longer intermittently reports that IP-VFC cards in ST 2110 output mode are PTP locked when they are not.
Manual changes to the IP VFC cards network configuration are now correctly undoable.
IP addresses in the IP-VFC editor will no longer react erratically to the scroll wheel.
IP-VFC cards in ST 2110 mode will now correctly stay in EXT sync mode when it is set.
The IP-VFC editor will now warn you if you enter an invalid multicast address.
The IP-VFC editor will now highlight your network settings in red if the IP address supplied is not on the same subnet as your gateway.
IP-VFC cards in ST 2110 mode will no longer intermittently fail to create a video stream.
The IP-VFC will now display a grey-pink border in the feed view if it is non-responsive.
d3service and Designer now log more verbosely about the state of IP-VFC when it’s being configured.
Designer will no longer display an access violation when joining a session with an IP-VFC card and loading directly into the feed view.
The IP-VFC GUI will now always update with the correct PTP clock ID after applying genlock or feed settings.
Machines will no longer hang indefinitely when applying feed settings if the first IP-VFC card in the server cannot detect a genlock source.
Designer will no longer intermittently display an access violation when inspecting a machine that has IP-VFC cards attached.
Once configured, the IP-VFC will now wait less time to output a video stream.
Designer will no longer display an access violation when opening the editor of a machine that had IP-VFC cards installed but is now offline.
IP-VFC cards will no longer intermittently fail to initialize properly on machine boot.
Genlocking a machine via the IP-VFC card is now much more reliable.
EX range director machines will now correctly apply IP-VFC configuration to actor machines with IP-VFC cards connected.
Servers with IP-VFC cards installed that are set to genlock in EXT sync mode now respond correctly to upstream genlock signal changes.
You no longer need to apply feed settings on every system reboot to output from IP-VFC cards.
You can now specify a default gamma space colour transform for all new ingested media and all newly created displays.
For DMX Screens you can now select the new GRBW Fixture type.
Selecting a new feed scene for a machine will now correctly update the feed name displayed in the feed view.
Changing the split mode of a Quad-split capable VFC card from **Mirror** to **Quad** or **Quad 4K** will no longer randomly create or delete virtual heads erroneously.
When changing the split mode of a VFC card it will no longer move the Matrix Routing settings of subsequent VFC cards onto their neighbors.
Changing Quad-split to Mirror mode will no longer intermittently display an access violation in specific projects.
We have made various improvements to tooltip behaviour in this release.
All OSC Event Transport messages now correctly highlight in blue when triggered.
d3service logs are now simpler to assist with troubleshooting.
Projects that specify extra dlls like d3labs.dll in their dlls.txt file will not longer fail to open if the dlls.txt file has mixed line endings.
Layers with mappings that target no screens which apply affects to PreComp textures no correctly force the layers rendering the PreComps to become active.

Video layers patched to Sockpuppet that have a live video input sequenced now correctly show the placeholder video clip (if one is selected for that video input) when the video input is disconnected. This matches the behaviour of normal video layers.

Updated the test patterns that come with Designer in the following ways: Fixed the 100% -> 0% greyscale to have correct colour values, Fixed the “Full Range” text to be the correct limited range colour values, Re-centred the content
mp4 video format files will now correctly be reported as unsupported when loaded, instead of reporting a cryptic error.
Include link to release notes webpage in help tab in d3manager
Performance improvement when modifying custom parameters for web layers

Shortcuts added to move selected layers/groups where the Playhead is: CTRL + [ to extend/trim the start, CTRL + ] to extend/trim the end, CTRL + ALT + [ to move the start while maintaining length, CTRL + ALT + ] to move the end while maintaining length.
OSC SockPuppet: Sending an empty string will now assign `None` to a resource field
Hierarchy->Add Child now allows you to select grandchildren objects.
Fixed an issue where low resolution screens appeared blurry in the visualiser. (Does not affect video output)
Fixed some performance issues in the web module
The Format field of a video input will now always update to the correct format instantly upon assignment of a new capture source.
Fixed an issue where Designer would sometimes not automatically create a share for the d3 projects folder if sharing settings had been manually edited.
Layer editors for groups now properly close all related keyframe widgets when closing
Mousing over the session icon in d3manager for a project will now correctly show the list of servers participating in that session again.
Notch and Renderstream Notch layers can now have their custom parameters controlled correctly by HTTPSockpuppet.
Renderstream layers can now have their scene field controlled correctly by HTTPSockpuppet.
The warning about expiring Notch licenses has been reworded to not say the word “Warning” twice.
Designer will no longer intermittently fail to quit fully when using ProRes video content, causing remote start-up to fail.
The UVLookup module will no longer sometimes show artifacts where there are large discontinuities in the UV lookup texture.
Fixed an issue where VFC Firmware and Generation would not be visible for remote machines in the feed view
Fixed an issue where the CameraControl layer did not send strings on playback
Fixed an issue where the CameraControl layer could not send a Preset above 15
Fixed an issue where BlackTrax with RTTrPM device did not snap points to tracked points correctly
Fixed an Access Violation when using RigidBody tracking workflow
Fixed an issue where adding a DMX screen with labels rendered to the stage would cause parallel and cylindrical mapping to no longer render their outlines
Fixed an Access Violation when viewing the Machine properties for any unconfigured/newly created Machine
Fixed an issue where running an xR or VP project that was using an NDI® source caused the input to stutter once a RenderStream layer is started
Fixed an issue where max() and min() expressions had the same behaviour
Fixed an issue where Nginx couldn’t start after installation if d3 nginx log folder is missing
EX 2, EX 2C, and EX 3+ Product Support.
Added conﬁrmation dialogue to global apply feed settings button
Right-clicking on a projector from the projector list view now opens the projector editor. This now behaves the same as other right-click behaviour.
When dropping frames, outputs between machines, and on the same machine will now re-synchronize faster. This also means the output will no longer stutter intermittently on VX 3 and VX 2+ machines.
EX range: Outputs in the feed view are no longer labelled as “No VFC”
Improved performance when using multiple HTTP Sockpuppet video layers
OSC SockPuppet: Text ﬁelds now have examples in their personality viewer
Fixed an issue where multiple feed rectangles in the same output feed could misalign by 1 pixel in certain scenarios.
Fixed an issue where LUTs applied to DMX Screens did not apply to DMX output.
Fixed an issue where d3manager could sometimes report understudy machines are still in session after they were quit remotely from Designer.
EX3/Solo: Fixed an issue where EDID emulation set to ‘always’ did not work unless displays were connected.
Fixed an issue where projector config from projector list editor could not be changed
Fixed an issue where FPS in the network status widget does not match FPS in the HUD
Fixed an issue where Windows 11 reported as Windows 10 22631 in Disguise Manager
Fixed an issue where the HardwareList instance had no attribute ‘close’ error when closing Video Input Patch Editor
Fixed an Access Violation when using RenderStream with Notch Blocks
Fixed an issue where enabling VITC on Matrox cards causes console spam failing to signal surface read completion
Fixed an issue where a black frame was present on a RenderStream layer when move section to next section
Fixed an issue where a new track select widget opened on every click in MultiTransport
Fixed a crash to desktop when failing to setup topology
Fixed a crash to desktop in d3 when jumping to cue on another track
Fixed an issue where the Video asset editor did not show file versions
Expression variables enable the sharing of values between Designer expressions.

New APIs have been added to failover a machine using the API. The following endpoints have been added and are documented at https://developer.disguise.one as well as in the documentation bundled with Designer which can be accessed from d3Manager at Help > Open API Documentation.
Fixed an issue where string formatting did not allow `module:name.field` syntax
Fixed a machine hang in `MatroxTopology::cleanupSurfaceBufferPool`
The d3Manager License dialogue now contains a section detailing the serial number(s) of local CodeMeter license containers.
Fixed spherical mapping rotation being incorrect
Fixed an issue where the Sockpuppet Notch layer moved the Effect field under Timecode Separator
Fixed Web browser-based layers not limiting to the max texture size available to the renderer
More Zoom Steps when Zoom In
Move ‘Collapse All Groups’ and ‘Clear Arrows’ into a dropdown
Add way to close all open layer editors
‘Collapse all Groups’ Should toggle to expand all groups
QuickAlign option to disable adding new points
Support multiple OSC floats in OSC position receiver
Transport “engaged” button should have a tooltip explaining when it’s allowed and when it’s not allowed to engage/disengage
Notes API - to be able to GET and POST notes
Manager to show list of locally connected (physical) CodeMeter containers in “d3 License” window
Fixed an issue that occurred n project launch, where d3manager warned “No valid Designer licence detected from d3service!” but continued to open the project
Fixed an issue where head names did not appear in the feed view
Fixed an issue where remote graphs sometimes failed to be sent to the director
Fixed an issue where DMX screens appeared inactive when the position was controlled with automation data until the visualiser camera was moved
Fixed undo (Ctrl + Z) not working work when deleting a tag
Sped up the timeSlideShow setup takes on projects with large number of video clips
Fixed an issue where WSAWaitForMultipleEvents was seen when using ArtNet
d3 installer now sets the d3.exe file properties to disabled for Windows versions later than 1809
API Docs page no longer returns blank white screen
Fixed an issue where a Note did not unsubscribe ResourceActions when deactivated
Fixed an issue where ObjectView did not unsubscribe ResourceActions before adding new ones
Fixed a hang that occurred when on adding / removing from timeline
Fixed an issue where live update was blocked blocked after long hangs on director
Fixed access violation when two machines on network have duplicate hostnames
OmniCal: Fixed an issue where a number of Projector inliers and total points were not serialised
Fixed shadow artefacts in dynamic blend with three projectors

ProRes video codecs are now supported for playout on Disguise. ProRes is a visually lossless codec that uses intra-frame compression, where each frame is stored independently and can be decoded with no dependencies on other frames. Users are now able to playout the following ProRes codecs from Disguise: ProRes 422, ProRes 422 HQ, ProRes 422 LT, ProRes 422 Proxy, ProRes 4444, ProRes 4444 XQ
This improvement prevents an error message outlining that access to the GPU device was lost on the actor machine when many high-resolution Notch LC video layers are used.

We have added proﬁleGPUPoolFromLaunch as an option switch to enable users to trigger the creation of a memory proﬁle so that they can understand the behaviour of a GPU pool for debugging purposes. This is exported as a .json ﬁle to a project folder called ‘output’.

In r27.5.1 we introduced DSOF-26887, which added GUI status to the ‘Output’ indicator on the Network Status Widget. The GUI icon follows the same convention as the other icons, namely if the GUI is on a Disguise media server running in session that the icon will be green. If it is off then the icon will be grey. The icon became orange if the GUI was on the understudy machines running in session. In r27.8 we have changed the icon to become green if the GUI was on the understudy machines running in session as seen in the screenshot below:
Fixed an issue where the debug console jittered when Video Prefetcher Report is visible during video playback, and the widget could not be resized
Fixed a BSOD when Scrubbing Timeline
Fixed new textures pool not responding to scrubbing
Fixed scrubbing detection failing during lengthy system hangs or in low frame rate scenarios
Fixed console logging omitting timestamp on some lines
Fixed an issue where the prefetcher created many unnecessary prefetch jobs while scrubbing
Lowered the GPU usage of Discovery ndirelay instance
Fixed an issue where overly active ‘Strict mode’ caused prefetch to miss and exhibit many errors
Requests in freelist no longer appear in the debug widget
Fixed an issue where VariableVideoModule held a reference to the last frame used even when not active
Texture parameters no longer switch places when using multiple texture parameters
Fixed an issue where CPU textures were constantly re-allocated while playing NotchLC blocks.
Fixed an issue where the Shot Recorder with a note in parameter collection caused a problem on project restart
Fixed an issue where EventTransportDmx did not highlight “Stop” in blue when it was selected, and Brightness was permanently highlighted when DMX is connected.
Fixed an issue wherelLayers with missing media did not update the red highlight when the layer start is dragged earlier
DMX SockPuppet: ‘DmxPersonality’ object is not callable when attempting to ‘View Personality’ in Patch Settings widget
‘GroupLayer’ object has no attribute ‘controlPatch’
Using UX fade with a UVLookup module results in an error and the playhead won’t advance beyond the section break.
Fixed a critical issue where Notch blocks were getting ‘LOGIC ERROR’ in r27.7.3
Fixed an issue where a duplicate process started when clicking on the start workload button from the timeline while the workload was already launching
Fixed an issue where timecode playmodes for layers were behaving inconsistently when playing to end of section with RenderStream
Fixed an Access Violation after closing the RenderStream widget
Fixed an issue where the debugLiveUpdate option switch was non-functional
Fixed an issue where Colour Calibration returned a black LUT and an .cube file with null values
Fixed an issue where extending the start of a layer using ctrl+< with the end of the layer at the end of track resulted in track lengthening
Fixed an issue where Designer threw an error when attempting to display an alert box after exporting personality
Fixed errors being raised when attempting to drag the heading in the RenderStream cluster workload window
Fixed an AccessViolation when patching RenderStream layer to sockpuppet
Fixed an issue where slideshows did not load
Fixed an Access Violation on startup relating to QuickProfiler
Notch instances that get prefetched but never end up being played through don’t return to Sleeping state
Render nodes marked as failed are now notified to prevent them contributing to network traffic
Discovery ndirelay instance now has a lower CPU usage
Fixed an issue where RenderStream Layers connected to sockpuppet may not have initialised personality types leading to Exceptions
Fixed an issue where the first command to an OSC Indirection did not change the resource
Fixed an issue where a capture group config can’t be saved on bluefish card
Add a link to learn.disguise.one in d3manager
Upgrade to Vimba X SDK for OmniCal
Custom colour primaries in Gamma Space mode
Designer will now respect the clipping planes defined in notch blocks.
OmniCal will check and notify the user if the wrong Vimba SDK is installed for use with the latest version of Designer.
Implement colour management interface with Notch version 1.0
Raise warning about Notch version 1.0 compatibility on unsupported servers.
Upgrade nsis to 3.10
Prewarm notch instances

There is now a TCP variant of the Indirection Controller, in addition to the existing variant which uses UDP. It works like a UDPIndirectionController with a key value pair list and when the user sends a TCP message with a new key it causes the indirection to switch.

In addition to control via OSC, Sockpuppet now supports control via the HTTP protocol. This makes Sockpuppet more easily controllable by web-based control interfaces and other networked components that utilize HTTP protocols.

Crash dumps are created when an unhandled exception occurs. This incurs a brief stall while the dump is generated. This behaviour is now opt-in and disabled by default.
Using the keyboard means the points move really slowly though. Adding modifiers means easier control of points without the movement being forced to be one slow speed.

When using an IP-VFC card, we have added error reporting into the feed scene in the form of a tooltip for the `Sync Mode` button. When a user is using the PTP option in sync mode, if there is no compatible 25Gb SFP in Port 1 on the IP-VFC then the sync mode button will turn red and a message will state the Disguise media server and VFC slot number which has the invalid configuration. When a user is using the EXT option in sync mode, if there is no compatible single or dual SDI SFP in Ports 3 and/or 4 on the IP-VFC then the sync mode button will turn red and a message will state the Disguise media server and VFC slot number which has the invalid configuration.

We have implemented a preview feature that allows d3 to chase timecode at non-standard frame rates. This can be used for example to adjust the playback speed of video in line with a DJs adjustments to the BPM of a track. To utilise this preview feature you can enable the option switch “forcePIDTimecodeChase”. Chasing LTC or any kind of timecode will smoothly follow adjustments to timecode playback while this is set. If you perform large timecode jumps you may find that the playhead will fast-forward to get to the new timecode rather than immediately jump to that point.

Simple FBX mesh support: The FBX file format can now be successfully imported into Designer as a single mesh. These can be used in the schematic, lux and heatmap renderers. Any FBX mesh will be imported with global positions, and non-triangulated meshes are triangulated on import. FBX files are imported with UV maps. It is important to note the following mitigations with this feature: Object hierarchies found within the FBX file in Designer are currently not supported. FBX files imported with up to 3x UV maps are supported. Designer uses the first UV map only and there is currently no way to switch between each UV map.

TransportJumpCommand locations should use time adjusted by timecode tag when using timecode location. When making a TransportJumpCommand in the TransportControl module, the location value has the option of being set with CUE or timecode. In previous releases, when there are timecode tags on the track that a user wants to specify a location on, the timecode displayed in the GUI is based on the timecode tags, but the location that the TransportJumpCommand uses does not take the timecode tags into account. In r26, the location for TransportJumpCommand now uses the time adjusted by timecode tags when using the timecode location.
Show RenderStream proxy stream status in the GUI. We have added RenderStream proxy information in the RenderStream Editor widget.

Make list/grid view selection for media/texture browsers persistent. In previous releases, the behaviour of the media and texture browser in Designer was not persistent when a user would switch between grid view and list view. In r26 we have made the selection of grid or list view in the media/texture browser to remain persistent across all machines running in a session.
Add FBX ASCII format for Shot Recorder export. Users can now export data from the Shot Recorder to the FBX ASCII format.

XR: improve usability of Tracker Delay UI. We have made a number of changes to the Tracker Delay UI. These include changing the overlay colour from magenta to red to signify when no tracking data was captured, or the delay is set to too low or too high. We have also introduced help text in a number of areas of the UI to provide instruction on the Tracker Delay process.

Alert the user when video lookup times becomes unstable or if errors are high. We have added a visible notification within the UI to notify users that the video receive delay is set incorrectly during the spatial calibration process when working with MR Sets. The calibration will be highlighted in red, and hovering over the row with a mouse will explain that there is a video receive delay error and to perform the delay calibration again.
DSV capture: minor performance optimisations.
DSV capture: add dropped frames detection.

Shorten RenderStream workload/stream friendly names for the UI. In previous releases, RenderStream workloads and streams were identified within the UI through a 64 bit unique ID to enable users to reference each stream. In r26 we have shortened the RenderStream workload names to make it more straightforward for a user to reference each RenderStream workload.

Expressions: if expressions are broken, the layer they are used in should change colour as well as the parameter. In previous releases, if an incorrect Expression had been written then this would be flagged to the user by turning the parameter orange in colour. In r26 we have included the layer that is using the Expression to also change to red in colour so that the user is notified that the Expression is incorrect. If the layer is in a group, then the group will turn red when the layer it contains turns red. We have also included an error message on the layer via a tooltip. If a user corrects the Expression then the layer will return to its default colour.
Better texture buffer management for LogicalVideoInDevice.
Make list editors stickyable. In r26 we have enabled users to pin ListEditors to the Designer UI by clicking the pin in the top left hand side of each ListEditor as seen in the image below.

Change default location for d3 Projects to D: Drive after reimaging a Disguise media server. In r26 we have changed the default location for d3 Projects to be in the D: Drive after reimaging a Disguise media server. In previous releases, a user would be pointed towards the Documents folder whereas all Designer projects should be located in the D: Drive.

Include display master brightness in the feed UI. We have included the master brightness of LED screens and projectors within the feed UI. This can be seen as a percentage underneath the name of each screen, as shown in the screenshot below.

Disguise Developer portal documentation and guidance website has launched to support building tools and integrations with the Disguise platform. The new website has been specifically made with developers and system integrators in mind, and includes Designer APIs and RenderStream SDK documentation.

Control and monitor Disguise media servers using a comprehensive HTTP API. Learn more here. API documentation is also available within Designer. The new APIs fall into two categories: The Service APIs relate to functionality provided by thed3service runtime and are available whenever Disguise is installed on a machine. The SessionAPIs relate to the currently running session and as such are only available when the d3 runtime is running. The previously existing V1 API, found at /api/v1, should be considered deprecated as of the launch of the stable API set under the Service and Session APIs. New API integrations should not target the V1 API and should instead use the APIs documented under /api/service and /api/session. No new APIs or functionality will be added to V1, however the V1 API will be maintained for the foreseeable future and we will give notice if we plan to remove it in the future.

Previz allows the user to export their stage and content from Designer, and upload it to Disguise drive as a Previz Scene. With a URL to the uploaded Previz Scene, users and Disguise show programmers can share the current state of the Disguise show without restricting the end customers with baked-in camera angles, or having to install Designer themselves.

Designer r22.1 offers users the ability to log in to Disguise Cloud through d3manager by clicking on the new “Sign In” button. When you sign in, you will be prompted to link your machine to your Disguise Cloud account by following the on-screen instructions.
If you have previously signed up for Disguise Cloud, you can link your Designer install to an existing Disguise Cloud account. If you’re new to Disguise Cloud, you can sign up for a new account.
If you do not have a Designer license you can acquire a Designer license via the Designer integration with Disguise Cloud.
To return to license activation click “Account” in the d3manager cloud menu. This will take you to your Disguise Cloud account details page which includes Designer license activation functionality.
Further Disguise Cloud integration functionality in Designer will be rolled out over the coming months.
